meanings.definition: A feudal tenure of land in which rent or other services are rendered.
meanings.sent1: In soccage, the tenant pays rent to the landlord for the land.
meanings.sent2: The soccage system allowed peasants to work the land in exchange for rent.
meanings.sent3: The soccage arrangement made the landlord chuckle as he collected his dues.
meanings.sent4: The concept of soccage is like a dance between the tenant and the landlord, each playing their part.
meanings.sent5: The idea of soccage is similar to a subscription service for land.

meanings.definition: The tenure of land by soccage.
meanings.sent1: The soccage of the estate was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: He inherited the soccage of the farm from his father.
meanings.sent3: The soccage of the land was a topic of gossip among the villagers.
meanings.sent4: The soccage of the property was like a precious heirloom to the family.
meanings.sent5: The soccage of the land felt like a warm embrace to the new owner.
